6#define V8_SANDBOX_COMPACTIBLE_EXTERNAL_ENTITY_TABLE_INL_H_

8#include "src/logging/counters.h"
9#include "src/sandbox/compactible-external-entity-table.h"

11#include "src/sandbox/external-pointer.h"

13#ifdef V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
14
15namespace v8 {
16namespace internal {
17
18template <typename Entry, size_t size>
19uint32_t CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::AllocateEntry(
20 Space* space) {
21 uint32_t index = Base::AllocateEntry(space);
22
23 // When we're compacting a space, we're trying to move all entries above a
24 // threshold index (the start of the evacuation area) into segments below
25 // that threshold. However, if the freelist becomes too short and we start
26 // allocating entries inside the area that is supposed to be evacuated, we
27 // need to abort compaction. This is not just an optimization but is also
28 // required for correctness: during sweeping we might otherwise assume that
29 // all entries inside the evacuation area have been moved and that these
30 // segments can therefore be deallocated. In particular, this check will also
31 // make sure that we abort compaction if we extend the space with a new
32 // segment and allocate at least one entry in it (if that segment is located
33 // after the threshold, otherwise it is unproblematic).
34 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area =
35 space->start_of_evacuation_area_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
36 if (V8_UNLIKELY(index >= start_of_evacuation_area)) {
37 space->AbortCompacting(start_of_evacuation_area);
38 }
39
40 return index;
41}
42
43template <typename Entry, size_t size>
44typename CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::CompactionResult
45CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::FinishCompaction(
46 Space* space, Histogram* counter) {
47 DCHECK(space->BelongsTo(this));
48 DCHECK(!space->is_internal_read_only_space());
49
50 // When compacting, we can compute the number of unused segments at the end of
51 // the table and deallocate those after sweeping.
52 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area =
53 space->start_of_evacuation_area_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
54 bool evacuation_was_successful = false;
55 if (space->IsCompacting()) {
56 auto outcome = ExternalEntityTableCompactionOutcome::kAborted;
57 if (space->CompactingWasAborted()) {
58 // Compaction was aborted during marking because the freelist grew to
59 // short. In this case, it is not guaranteed that any segments will now be
60 // completely free. Extract the original start_of_evacuation_area value.
61 start_of_evacuation_area &= ~Space::kCompactionAbortedMarker;
62 } else {
63 // Entry evacuation was successful so all segments inside the evacuation
64 // area are now guaranteed to be free and so can be deallocated.
65 evacuation_was_successful = true;
66 outcome = ExternalEntityTableCompactionOutcome::kSuccess;
67 }
68 DCHECK(IsAligned(start_of_evacuation_area,
69 ExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::kEntriesPerSegment));
70
71 space->StopCompacting();
72 counter->AddSample(static_cast<int>(outcome));
73 }
74
75 return {start_of_evacuation_area, evacuation_was_successful};
76}
77
78template <typename Entry, size_t size>
79void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::MaybeCreateEvacuationEntry(
80 Space* space, uint32_t index, Address handle_location) {
81 // Check if the entry should be evacuated for table compaction.
82 // The current value of the start of the evacuation area is cached in a local
83 // variable here as it otherwise may be changed by another marking thread
84 // while this method runs, causing non-optimal behaviour (for example, the
85 // allocation of an evacuation entry _after_ the entry that is evacuated).
86 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area =
87 space->start_of_evacuation_area_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
88 if (index >= start_of_evacuation_area) {
89 DCHECK(space->IsCompacting());
90 uint32_t new_index =
91 Base::AllocateEntryBelow(space, start_of_evacuation_area);
92 if (new_index) {
93 DCHECK_LT(new_index, start_of_evacuation_area);
94 DCHECK(space->Contains(new_index));
95 // Even though the new entry will only be accessed during sweeping, this
96 // still needs to be an atomic write as another thread may attempt (and
97 // fail) to allocate the same table entry, thereby causing a read from
98 // this memory location. Without an atomic store here, TSan would then
99 // complain about a data race.
100 Base::at(new_index).MakeEvacuationEntry(handle_location);
101 } else {
102 // In this case, the application has allocated a sufficiently large
103 // number of entries from the freelist so that new entries would now be
104 // allocated inside the area that is being compacted. While it would be
105 // possible to shrink that area and continue compacting, we probably do
106 // not want to put more pressure on the freelist and so instead simply
107 // abort compaction here. Entries that have already been visited will
108 // still be compacted during Sweep, but there is no guarantee that any
109 // blocks at the end of the table will now be completely free.
110 space->AbortCompacting(start_of_evacuation_area);
111 }
112 }
113}
114
115template <typename Entry, size_t size>
116void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::Space::StartCompacting(
117 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area) {
118 DCHECK_EQ(invalidated_fields_.size(), 0);
119 start_of_evacuation_area_.store(start_of_evacuation_area,
120 std::memory_order_relaxed);
121}
122
123template <typename Entry, size_t size>
124void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::Space::StopCompacting() {
125 start_of_evacuation_area_.store(kNotCompactingMarker,
126 std::memory_order_relaxed);
127}
128
129template <typename Entry, size_t size>
130void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::Space::AbortCompacting(
131 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area) {
132 uint32_t compaction_aborted_marker =
133 start_of_evacuation_area | kCompactionAbortedMarker;
134 DCHECK_NE(compaction_aborted_marker, kNotCompactingMarker);
135 start_of_evacuation_area_.store(compaction_aborted_marker,
136 std::memory_order_relaxed);
137}
138
139template <typename Entry, size_t size>
140bool CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::Space::IsCompacting() {
141 return start_of_evacuation_area_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed) !=
142 kNotCompactingMarker;
143}
144
145template <typename Entry, size_t size>
146bool CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry,
147 size>::Space::CompactingWasAborted() {
148 auto value = start_of_evacuation_area_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
149 return (value & kCompactionAbortedMarker) == kCompactionAbortedMarker;
150}
151
152template <typename Entry, size_t size>
153bool CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::Space::FieldWasInvalidated(
154 Address field_address) const {
155 invalidated_fields_mutex_.AssertHeld();
156 return std::find(invalidated_fields_.begin(), invalidated_fields_.end(),
157 field_address) != invalidated_fields_.end();
158}
159
160template <typename Entry, size_t size>
161void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry,
162 size>::Space::ClearInvalidatedFields() {
163 invalidated_fields_mutex_.AssertHeld();
164 invalidated_fields_.clear();
165}
166
167template <typename Entry, size_t size>
168void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry, size>::Space::AddInvalidatedField(
169 Address field_address) {
170 if (IsCompacting()) {
171 base::MutexGuard guard(&invalidated_fields_mutex_);
172 invalidated_fields_.push_back(field_address);
173 }
174}
175
176template <typename Entry, size_t size>
177void CompactibleExternalEntityTable<Entry,
178 size>::Space::StartCompactingIfNeeded() {
179 // Take the lock so that we can be sure that no other thread modifies the
180 // segments set concurrently.
181 base::MutexGuard guard(&this->mutex_);
182
183 // This method may be executed while other threads allocate entries from the
184 // freelist. In that case, this method may use incorrect data to determine if
185 // table compaction is necessary. That's fine however since in the worst
186 // case, compaction will simply be aborted right away if the freelist became
187 // too small.
188 uint32_t num_free_entries = this->freelist_length();
189 uint32_t num_total_entries = this->capacity();
190
191 // Current (somewhat arbitrary) heuristic: need compacting if the space is
192 // more than 1MB in size, is at least 10% empty, and if at least one segment
193 // can be freed after successful compaction.
194 double free_ratio = static_cast<double>(num_free_entries) /
195 static_cast<double>(num_total_entries);
196 uint32_t num_segments_to_evacuate =
197 (num_free_entries / 2) / Base::kEntriesPerSegment;
198 uint32_t space_size = num_total_entries * Base::kEntrySize;
199 bool should_compact = (space_size >= 1 * MB) && (free_ratio >= 0.10) &&
200 (num_segments_to_evacuate >= 1);
201
202 // However, if --stress-compaction is enabled, we compact whenever possible:
203 // whenever we have at least one segment worth of empty entries.
204 if (v8_flags.stress_compaction) {
205 should_compact = num_free_entries > Base::kEntriesPerSegment;
206 }
207
208 if (should_compact) {
209 // If we're compacting, attempt to free up the last N segments so that they
210 // can be decommitted afterwards.
211 auto first_segment_to_evacuate =
212 *std::prev(this->segments_.end(), num_segments_to_evacuate);
213 uint32_t start_of_evacuation_area = first_segment_to_evacuate.first_entry();
214 StartCompacting(start_of_evacuation_area);
215 }
216}
217
218} // namespace internal
219} // namespace v8

221#endif // V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS
